What else can be added to kharcho soup
To make the broth more rich and tasty, you can add parsley root, 1-2 stalks of celery, cilantro or parsley, and even half a small carrot. All these ingredients must be removed after 1-1.5 hours.
Kharcho is also cooked with other types of meat, such as lamb, pork, and even chicken. Of course, this is a departure from the classic recipe, but the soup turns out to be no less tasty.
A common ingredient in Kharcho is rice. About 50-60 g or a little more will be enough for such a volume to make the soup thicker.

Tkemali sauce can be replaced with plum varieties of the same name - they are added at the stage of cooking meat. Another classic option is tklapi acid pita breads, which make tkemali or dogwood plums rolled out into a thin layer and dried pulp.
Tklapi gives the kharcho soup a unique taste. datota / Depositphotos.com
For the soup you will need a piece about the size of about half a palm or a little more. Tklapi must first be soaked in several tablespoons of broth and added to the soup along with seasonings.

Another alternative to give acidity is a grant sauce or juice, and it is better to use freshly squeezed. Also in the soup you can add a couple of tablespoons of tomato paste, canned tomatoes in their own juice or fresh tomato.
